tldr: Q4 FY2025 revenue increased 7% to $23.9B with EPS up 18% to $2.68, driven by strong ISG margins and storage mix. Dell posted FY2025 revenue of $95.6B and EPS of $8.14, and guided FY2026 revenue of $101B-$105B with EPS of $9.3 +/- $0.25 on $15B of AI server shipments.
bullets: Q4 revenue rose 7% to $23.9B with EPS up 18% to $2.68; ISG margin hit a record 18.1%.
AI orders were $1.7B and shipments were $2.1B, with $4.1B backlog; AI backlog reached about $9B as of February.
FY2026 guide: revenue $101B-$105B, EPS $9.3 +/- $0.25, ISG high-teens growth on $15B of AI shipments.
themes: Pricing and cost pressure shaping margins

segments.title: Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG)
points: Revenue grew 22% to $11.4B; server and networking revenue rose 37% to $6.6B.
Storage revenue increased 5% to $4.7B with strong PowerStore and PowerScale demand.
Operating income rose 44% to $2.1B with a record 18.1% margin.

segments.title: Client Solutions Group (CSG)
points: Revenue rose 1% to $11.9B; commercial revenue grew 5% while consumer declined 12%.
Operating income was $600M (5.3% margin) on competitive pricing pressure.

segments.title: AI servers and backlog
points: AI orders were $1.7B and shipments were $2.1B, with backlog ending at $4.1B.
AI backlog expanded to about $9B as of February, with enterprise adoption rising.

notes.title: Capital return
points: Raised annual dividend 18% to $2.10 per share and authorized an additional $10B buyback.
Returned $10.8B since FY2023 inception through repurchases and dividends.

notes.title: FY2026 margin outlook
points: Gross margin rate expected to decline about 100 bps on AI mix and competition.
ISG margin guided roughly flat; CSG slightly down.

themes.title: FY2026 AI growth assumptions
points: Guidance assumes at least $15B in AI shipments with continued pipeline expansion.
Management sees supply improving but cites data center readiness constraints.

themes.title: Tariffs and pricing
points: Management said new tariff announcements were not included in guidance.
Tariff costs are treated as input costs with pricing actions as needed.

top_questions.question: How can ISG margins stay flat with AI mix growing?
top_questions.summary: Dell expects storage leverage, Dell IP mix, and scale benefits to offset AI mix dilution.

top_questions.question: What is embedded in the FY2026 guide for AI shipments?
top_questions.summary: Guidance assumes at least $15B in AI server shipments with pipeline multiples of backlog.

top_questions.question: Are tariffs included in the FY2026 outlook?
top_questions.summary: Management noted new tariff announcements were not included and would be addressed via supply chain and pricing.

implications: Record ISG margins suggest Dell IP storage mix and AI services attach are scaling.
FY2026 AI shipment target sets a higher bar for supply chain execution and customer readiness.
competitive_notes: CSG pricing remains competitive with consumer weakness and enterprise refresh pushed into H2.
forecast_hooks: Track FY2026 AI shipment ramp versus $15B target.
Monitor storage mix and margin contribution as Dell IP share grows.
Watch PC refresh cadence ahead of Windows 10 end-of-life.

action_items: Validate AI backlog conversion timing against Blackwell supply ramp.
Check enterprise PC pipeline for refresh acceleration into H2 FY2026.
open_questions: How quickly can storage attach rates scale with AI deployments?
What pricing actions will be required if tariffs expand further?
watch_next_quarter: Q1 FY2026 ISG margin seasonality versus guidance.
Updates on AI backlog beyond the $9B level.
